without.translation[0].definitions[0].de: not having something, especially something that is basic or necessary
without.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: After the storm we were without electricity for five days.
We passed two ruined abbeys, one with a tower and one without.
I’m getting used to managing without a car.
without.translation[0].definitions[1].de: used to say that a particular thing has not happened when someone does something
without.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Suddenly and without any warning, the army opened fire.
He had gone out without his parents’ permission.
I accepted his offer without a moment’s hesitation.
I got to my destination without too much difficulty.
Without so much as a word of thanks, Ben turned and went back into the office  (=he did not even say thank you as he should have done).
‘What do you expect?’ he said, without looking at her.
without.translation[0].definitions[2].de: not feeling or showing that you feel a particular emotion
without.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: He told his story without anger or bitterness.
without.translation[0].definitions[3].de: not being with someone, or not having them to help you, especially someone you like or need
without.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: I don’t know what I’d do without you.
Won’t you be lonely without her?
The rest of the group set off without him.
